screen_desc: The screenshot shows the app drawer of an Android smartphone. It displays a grid of icons for various applications such as Play Store, Clock, Calendar, Maps, Drive, Camera, Chrome, Contacts, and others. Additional functionalities can be accessed by clicking on these icons. The Google search bar is at the top, and at the bottom, there is a navigation bar with back, home, and recent apps buttons. The clock at the top shows the time as 10:39.
action_think: The user has opened the app drawer and the current screen is the home screen displaying app icons. To open a new Chrome private tab, the next step is to launch the Chrome app and then initiate the private browsing mode. Since Chrome is visible in the app drawer, I will select it first and then proceed with opening a private tab.
action_plan: Tap on the Chrome icon to open the Chrome browser.
Once Chrome is opened, tap on the three-dot menu icon in the top-right corner.
Select the 'New incognito tab' option from the menu.
action_result:
By clicking on the Chrome icon, the user has opened the Chrome browser app. However, the current screen shows that the user is on the Booking.com website, not in a new private tab. This means that although the Chrome browser was successfully launched, the specific action of opening a new private tab was not completed. 

To complete the user request, the next step would be to either manually open a new private tab within the Chrome browser or perform the action to do so. Therefore, this action has not yet made progress towards fulfilling the request of opening a new Chrome private tab.
